BusinessOfficerGrp.PersonTitleTxt: CFO & VP OF FINANCE AND ADMIN

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO CHANGE THE LIVES OF ADULT STUDENTS THROUGH PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE DEGREES AND CERTIFICATIONS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: GOLDEN GATE UNIVERSITY PREPARES INDIVIDUALS TO LEAD AND SERVE BY PROVIDING HIGH QUALITY, PRACTICE-BASED EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS IN LAW, TAXATION, BUSINESS AND RELATED PROFESSIONS - AS A NONPROFIT INSTITUTION - IN AN INNOVATIVE AND CHALLENGING LEARNING ENVIRONMENT.
IRS990.Desc: HIGHER EDUCATION IS THE UNIVERSITY'S SOLE MISSION AND PROGRAM. GGU OFFERS UNDERGRADUATE DEGREES IN BUSINESS AND MANAGEMENT, AND GRADUATE DEGREES IN LAW, TAXATION, BUSINESS AND RELATED PROFESSIONS THROUGH COURSES OFFERED IN CALIFORNIA (NORTHERN CALIFORNIA AND LOS ANGELES), WASHINGTON (SEATTLE), AND THE INTERNET. FULL TIME ENROLLMENT (FTE) FOR THE ACADEMIC YEAR 2017-2018 WAS 1,897.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: VP OF DEV AND ALUMNI RELATIONS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE UNIVERSITY USES THE INCOME FROM THE ENDOWMENT FUND PRIMARILY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS ACCORDING TO THE DONOR'S RESTRICTION. SMALL AMOUNTS ARE ALSO USED FOR OPERATING EXPENSES AT DESIGNATED SCHOOLS WITHIN THE UNIVERSITY AND FOR FACULTY SUPPORT AS DESIGNATED BY THE DONOR.
THE PRINCIPAL ACTIVITIES OF THE UNIVERSITY ARE EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES UNDER PROVISIONS OF THE U.S. INTERNAL REVENUE CODE, SECTION 501(C)(3) AND THE CALIFORNIA TAX CODE.
SCHOLARSHIPS RECLASSIFIED TO EXPENSES -11,259,855. LOSS ON FIXED ASSETS DISPOSAL RECLASSIFIED TO EXPENSES -4,777. MISCELLANEOUS EXPENSES RECLASSIFIED TO EXPENSES -271,648.
SCHOLARSHIPS RECLASSIFIED TO EXPENSES 11,259,855. LOSS ON FIXED ASSETS DISPOSAL RECLASSIFIED TO EXPENSES 4,777. MISCELLANEOUS EXPENSES RECLASSIFIED TO EXPENSES 271,648.
THE NONDISCRIMINATORY DISCLOSURE STATEMENT IS CONTAINED ON OUT-REACH MATERIALS, COURSE SCHEDULES, THE CATALOG AND OUR WEBSITE.

GOLDEN GATE UNIVERSITY (GGU) ASSISTS ITS STUDENTS THROUGH THE OPERATION OF COMPREHENSIVE FINANCIAL AID PROGRAMS. THE FINANCIAL AID PROGRAMS INCLUDE A FEDERAL REVOLVING LOAN PROGRAM ADMINISTERED BY GGU. WHEN A STUDENT CEASES TO BE ENROLLED IN GGU (AND AFTER A GRACE PERIOD), THE STUDENT IS EXPECTED TO BEGIN MAKING PAYMENTS WITH THE ULTIMATE GOAL OF RETURNING THE LOAN FUNDS. UNDER AN AGREEMENT WITH THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT, PORTIONS OF THE PRINCIPAL AND INTEREST DUE ON STUDENT NOTES RECEIVABLE MAY BE CANCELED UNDER CERTAIN CONDITIONS. GGU IS REIMBURSED BY THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT FOR SUBSTANTIALLY ALL OF GGU'S PORTION OF THE CANCELLATIONS. IN ADDITION TO THE FUNDS RECEIVED UNDER THE REVOLVING LOAN PROGRAM, GGU RECEIVES DIRECTLY OR ACTS AS A PASS-THROUGH AGENT FOR A VARIETY OF FEDERAL AID PROGRAMS, INCLUDING LOANS AND GRANTS.
SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS ARE USED TO OFFSET THE COST OF TUITION. MONEY IS NOT AVAILABLE TO PERSONS NOT ENROLLED AT THE UNIVERSITY.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.NonCashAssistanceDesc: GIFT CARDS FOR BOOKS AND SUPPLIES

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GGU DISBURSES FUNDS FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES WITHIN THE MEANING OF IRC SECTION 170(C)(2). DISBURSEMENTS TO INDIVIDUALS ARE AWARDS OF SCHOLARSHIPS TO QUALIFYING STUDENTS IN FURTHERANCE OF THEIR EDUCATIONAL PURSUITS. SEE GGU'S SCHOLARSHIP POLICY: HTTP://WWW.GGU.EDU/ENROLLMENT/FINANCIAL-AID/SCHOLARSHIPS-AND-GRANTS
DAN ANGEL, FORMER PRESIDENT, RECEIVED SEVERANCE OF $324,869.

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: TO REFUND CEFA 2001 AND 2005; ACQUIRE, CONSTRUCT AND RENOVATE FACILITIES

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THIS COLUMN REPRESENTS THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS, NOT THE NUMBER OF ITEMS CONTRIBUTED.

VOLUNTEERS AT GGU REPORTED INCLUDE MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, DEANS' ADVISORY BOARDS, ALUMNI ASSOCIATION BOARD OF DIRECTORS, AND A FEW ADVISORY BOARDS FOR SPECIFIC AREAS AND CAMPUSES (E.G., GGU FORENSIC ACCOUNTING ADVISORY BOARD, GGU INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY LAW CENTER ADVISORY BOARD, GGU TAX ADVISORY BOARD - LOS ANGELES, GGU TAX ADVISORY BOARD - SEATTLE).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GGU'S ACCOUNTING FIRM COMPLETES THE FORM 990 FOR THE UNIVERSITY. THE CONTROLLER SUBMITS THE FORM 990 TO THE CFO FOR REVIEW AND DISCUSSION. AS NEEDED, THE DISCUSSION IS HELD WITH THE ACCOUNTING FIRM AND REVISIONS ARE MADE. THE FINAL DRAFT OF THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO, REVIEWED, AND APPROVED BY GGU AUDIT COMMITTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH NEW MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES WILL RECEIVE, IN HIS OR HER ORIENTATION PACKAGE, A COPY OF THE GOLDEN GATE UNIVERSITY CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ACCOMPANIED BY THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY QUESTIONNAIRE. PRIOR TO THE NEW TRUSTEE'S INDUCTION INTO THE BOARD, HE OR SHE WILL SIGN AND DATE THE FORM, AND SUBMIT IT TO THE SECRETARY TO THE BOARD FOR INCLUSION IN BOARD RECORDS. AT THE ANNUAL BOARD MEETING EACH YEAR, ALL TRUSTEES SHALL COMPLETE A NEW CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY QUESTIONNAIRE, AND SUBMIT IT TO THE SECRETARY TO THE BOARD FOR INCLUSION IN BOARD RECORDS. BOARD MEMBERS WHO FAIL TO SUBMIT AN UPDATED QUESTIONNAIRE MAY BE SUBJECT TO EXPULSION FROM GOLDEN GATE UNIVERSITY'S BOARD OF TRUSTEES. IF A CONFLICT IS BELIEVED TO EXIST, THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OR ITS COMMITTEES WILL RESOLVE THE QUESTION IN THE ABSENCE OF THE POTENTIALLY INTERESTED PERSON. IF A CONFLICT EXISTS, THE TRUSTEE SHALL ABSTAIN FROM VOTING ON SUCH MATTERS UNDER CONSIDERATION BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OR ITS COMMITTEES. EACH NEW FULL-TIME EMPLOYEE WILL RECEIVE, IN HIS OR HER ORIENTATION PACKAGE, A COPY OF THE GOLDEN GATE UNIVERSITY CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ACCOMPANIED BY THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY QUESTIONNAIRE. THE NEW EMPLOYEE WILL SIGN AND DATE THE QUESTIONNAIRE WITHIN 30 DAYS OF HIS OR HER DATE OF HIRE AND SUBMIT IT TO THE HUMAN RESOURCES DEPARTMENT. THE QUESTIONNAIRE WILL BE FILED IN THE EMPLOYEE'S OFFICIAL PERSONNEL FILE MAINTAINED BY THE HUMAN RESOURCES DEPARTMENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL OFFICERS - THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE WILL ADMINISTER THIS EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION POLICY BY: - ASSESSING THE NATURE AND SCOPE OF EACH OFFICER POSITION - ASSESSING THE BASIS FOR WHICH COMPENSATION IS PAID TO INDIVIDUALS HOLDING SUCH POSITIONS INCLUDING UNIQUE BACKGROUND, EXPERIENCE, PERSONAL SKILLS, EXCEPTIONAL PERFORMANCE, ADDITIONAL DUTIES AND ABILITIES, AND CHALLENGES FACING THE ORGANIZATION THAT REQUIRE THE USE OF SUCH ATTRIBUTES OR SKILLS - OBTAINING APPROPRIATE AND COMPARABLE COMPENSATION MARKET DATA INCLUDING DATA FROM THE FOLLOWING: - SIMILARLY SITUATED ORGANIZATIONS, BOTH FOR-PROFIT AND TAX-EXEMPT, FOR FUNCTIONALLY COMPARABLE POSITIONS - THE AVAILABILITY OF SIMILAR SPECIALTIES IN THE GEOGRAPHIC AREA - INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION SURVEYS BY NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED INDEPENDENT FIRMS VICE PRESIDENTS - THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AUTHORIZES THE PRESIDENT TO ESTABLISH COMPENSATION RECOMMENDATIONS FOR THE VICE PRESIDENT OF ACADEMIC AFFAIRS AND THE VICE PRESIDENT OF BUSINESS AFFAIRS BASED ON HIS ASSESSMENT OF EACH INDIVIDUAL'S PERFORMANCE AND SCOPE OF THE POSITION AND COMPARABLE COMPENSATION MARKET DATA AS DESCRIBED ABOVE. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD WILL THEN MEET WITH THE PRESIDENT TO DISCUSS AND REVIEW HIS RECOMMENDATIONS, AND APPROVE, REQUEST ADDITIONAL INFORMATION OR AMEND THE RECOMMENDATION ON THE BASIS OF THEIR DISCUSSIONS. PRESIDENT - THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MEETS INDEPENDENTLY OF THE PRESIDENT TO DISCUSS PERFORMANCE RELATIVE TO THE POSITION DESCRIPTION. DURING THESE DELIBERATIONS, THE COMMITTEE ALSO CONSIDERS INPUT OBTAINED FROM OTHER BOARD MEMBERS, STAFF, FACULTY, AND OTHER INFORMED COMMUNITY LEADERS. ONCE A CONSENSUS IS REACHED REGARDING PERFORMANCE, A SIMILAR DISCUSSION IS HELD CONCERNING COMPENSATION RELATIVE TO ANNUAL BENCHMARK AND ESTABLISHED OBJECTIVES. THE COMMITTEE PRESENTS ITS FINDINGS AND RECOMMENDATIONS, IN AN EXECUTIVE SESSION WITHOUT THE PRESIDENT PRESENT, TO THE FULL BOARD FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL. THE COMMITTEE AND/OR THE BOARD CHAIR (A MEMBER OF THE COMMITTEE) THEN MEET WITH THE PRESIDENT TO DISCUSS AND DOCUMENT STRENGTHS, WEAKNESSES, AND GOALS FOR THE UPCOMING YEAR. COMPENSATION FOR THE UPCOMING YEAR IS ALSO DISCUSSED AND DOCUMENTED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: UPON REQUEST TO THE OFFICE OF THE CFO. IN ADDITION WE PROVIDE OUR AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS TO OUR BOND TRUSTEE AND THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VII, SECTION A, LINE 1A:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TED MITCHELL RECEIVED COMPENSATION FOR HIS SERVICE AS PROFESSOR AT THE UNIVERSITY DURING CALENDAR YEAR 2017. HE WAS NOT COMPENSATED FOR HIS SERVICE AS MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.
